result.execSummary:
The defendant Bjonca K. Secora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
**4 days sentence credit if revoked from Probation**
Concurrent with: 22CF35

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with apartments located at 1877 Whistling Straits Drive, Altoona.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. All Stayed pending further order of the Court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bjonca K. Secora

records.addlTxt: Judgment & Certification of Debt returned as undeliverable
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights and attached agreement

1:56 PM cases 22CF35, 22CF36, and 21CF733 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bjonca K. Secora in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Bjonca K. Secora. 
Warrants in all files are quashed. There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant to be fingerprinted in 22CF36, 
In 22CF36: Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Information and acknowledges prior conviction. 
In 22CF35: Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2 as charged in the Information and acknowledges prior conviction. 
In 21CF733: Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Information and acknowledges prior conviction. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts plea, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
As to Count 1 in 21CF733: Court orders defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges and provide a DNA sample. 
As to Count 1 in 22CF36 and 22CF35: Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 1 year with conditions: 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. No Contact with Apartment building located at 1877 Whistling Straits Drive in Altoona. 
Defendant to pay court costs on each count including one bench warrant fee in 22CF35. 
As to Count 1 in 22CF36: 90 Days in Jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Defendant has 4 days credit (3 days imputed from 21CF733) in 22CF36 if revoked from Probation.
Return on warrant on April 27, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

3:30 PM cases 21CF733, 22CF35, 22CF36 called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Bjonca K. Secora not in court and does not appear via zoom.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Bjonca K. Secora. Defense advises he made many efforts to contact the defendant but did not succeed in doing so. State requests a warrant- So ordered ($1,000 cash bond). Defendant must quash the warrant in person.

10:48 AM Cases called: 21CF733, 22CF35 & 22CF36 Defendant Bjonca K. Secora did not appear in court, Attorney James H Krave for Bjonca K. Secora appeared by video, Attorney Peter J. Rindal for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Parties are close to an agreement. Plea date scheduled for 04/19/22 at 3:30pm. If no plea at next hearing, a trial will be set.
Plea hearing on April 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Same as Complaint.
Status conference on March 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Cases called at 3:39 PM: 21CF733, 22CF35, 22CF36. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Bjonca K. Secora appeared in court, Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Bjonca K. Secora, District Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives her right to Preliminary Hearing in 22CF35 and 22CF36.
Defendant ordered to provide finger prints by end of business day on 2/17/22.
ARGN: 3/17/22 at 10:45 AM (in person with Attorney Krave to appear via Zoom).
Status conference on February 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Dated 02/14/2022, Letter from Attorney James Krave to Court requesting Zoom appearance for 02/14/2022 Status Conference.
Status conference on February 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

A status conference is scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 3:45 PM (in person).

(Cases 22CF35, 22CF36 are called at 11:09 AM- by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Bjonca K. Secora appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Sonia L Anderson. 
Defense waives reading of the complaints in 22CF35, 22CF36. Defendant updates address and is eligible for Public Defender representation. Time limits for preliminary hearings in 22CF35, 22CF36 are waived.
